{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3482000,"name":"kglasnapp","username":"kglasnapp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/dfb087/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T13:48:38.076Z","cooked":"

Help – I have two identical RoboRio’s. They are up to date with the latest image and I unable to SSH into one of them. I have tried two different laptops. I get SSH connection refused. I connected to both of the RoboRio via usb. The only connections on the RoboRIO is power and the USB connector. I used the same command to ssh into the RoboRio’s.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T13:48:38.076Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":45,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":252.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481641,"topic_slug":"cant-ssh-into-roborio","display_username":"kglasnapp","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28527,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cant-ssh-into-roborio/481641/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3494719,"name":"Eric Mintz","username":"emintz137","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ea5d25/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T15:31:35.763Z","cooked":"

I am having the same trouble with SSH.

Configuration

Operating system: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS
Connection type: wired Ethernet

RoboRio Network Configuration

IP Address (via DHCP): 192.168.17.64
Status (from nmap):

Nmap scan report for 192.168.17.72
Host is up (0.00031s latency).
Not shown: 994 closed tcp ports (conn-refused)
PORT     STATE SERVICE
21/tcp   open  ftp
22/tcp   open  ssh
80/tcp   open  http
443/tcp  open  https
3580/tcp open  nati-svrloc
5810/tcp open  unknown

SSH-Related Problem Description

I am using the login/password pairs specified on the roboRIO User Accounts and SSH page of the
FRC Game Manual

Here’s what happens when I try to ssh to the lvuser account with a blank password as specified:

ssh lvuser@192.168.17.64
lvuser@192.168.17.64's password: 
Permission denied, please try again.

The same happens when I try admin:

ssh admin@192.168.17.64
admin@192.168.17.64's password: 
Permission denied, please try again.

HTTP/HTTPS-Related Problem

Browser:

Mozilla Firefox 134.0.2

http://192.168.17.64/: Redirects to https://192.168.17.64/
https://192.168.17.64/: Unable to connect
http://192.168.17.64:8080/: Jetty 9 home page
https://192.168.17.64:8080/:


Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to 192.168.17.64:8080. SSL received a record that exceeded the maximum permissible length.

Error code: SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG

    The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.
    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

Please help. Thank you.

What is your network setup? How did you determine that was the roboRIO IP address? That’s not what I’d expect.

I was able to fix my SSH problem by simply reimaging the failing RoboRio. It seems that your RoboRio might be stuck in safe mode. Reimaging it gets the RoboRio out of safe mode.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-29T13:37:29.964Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481641,"topic_slug":"cant-ssh-into-roborio","display_username":"kglasnapp","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28527,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cant-ssh-into-roborio/481641/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3495655,"name":"Eric Mintz","username":"emintz137","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ea5d25/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T16:00:07.198Z","cooked":"

I plugged the RoboRio into my LAN and found its address via

nmap 192.168.17.1/24

Reimaging the RoboRio fixed it, though I still cannot ssh via the USB. I suspect that’s a problem on my computer.

In any case, job done! Thanks.
